bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, November 28, 1952

div1.p: Jefferson Medical College, from which Finlay graduated, will send a representative to the dedication of Camp Lazear. Hench discusses other preparations for the ceremony.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Pedro Nogueira, November 28, 1952
div1.opener:
November 28, 1952
Dr. Pedro Nogueira
Marti 219, Marianao
Habana, Cuba
My dear Pedro:
div1.p:
I think you and your colleagues will be delighted that Jefferson Medical
College, from which Carlos Finlay graduated, is actually sending a delegate to
Cuba. He also wishes to lay a wreath in honor of Finlay and two or three other
institutions have written me that they wish to participate. I will tell you
about these on my arrival.

I hope you approve of my sending Jefferson Medical College and Doctor Tocantins
one of the invitations you sent to me. You can give him a formal one on his
arrival in Havana. I am sure he would like to receive from you or one of the
committee a formal invitation on his arrival so that he is assured of a welcome.

Is the American Embassy participating in the affair? I am sure that they will
want to. I think Mr. Willard L. Beaulac is the American Ambassador. I assume
that you have invited him. I have just had a personal, unofficial letter from
him saying that he would be pleased to give a reception at his house (American
Embassy or home of the Ambassador?) for any distinguished guests from America and
for certain Cubans. I gather that he would be delighted to participate in the
ceremony at Camp Lazear and as I know that you were planning to invite him, I
assume of course that he has already received an invitation. Perhaps Doctor
Saladrigas, you or one of your associates might call Mr. Beaulac. If a recep-
tion is to be given, he will have to make plans immediately.

I understand that the American Medical Association wishes to have a representa-
tive at the ceremony and I believe General Streit will lay a wreath in honor of
Finlay for the Surgeon General and one in honor of Reed for the Walter Reed
Memorial Association. If it seems appropriate to lay one of these wreaths on
Finlay's grave rather than at Camp Lazear, we can arrange that.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
